revised_title: Development of Trypanosoma brucei Strain from Zululand in Glossina morsitans
tldr: The authors investigate the development of the Zululand strain of Trypanosoma brucei in Glossina morsitans, finding that it takes an average of 21 days for the cycle to be complete and the fly to become infective. The study compares the development of this strain to the trypanosome causing disease in man in Nyasaland, revealing similarities in their development in the fly.
